author: AFRICA-NEWS
title: Facebook’s Facial Recognition Feature Violates Users’ Privacy Rights, Groups Allege
text:
/ south africa Facebook’s Facial Recognition Feature Violates Users’ Privacy Rights, Groups Allege 
WASHINGTON—Consumer groups filed a complaint with federal regulators Friday, saying Facebook Inc. violates users’ privacy rights through its facial-recognition software. 
The complaint to the Federal Trade Commission is the latest in a string of privacy-related headaches for the social-media giant, including charges that it allowed personal data of 87 million users to leak to Cambridge Analytica, a firm with ties to the 2016 campaign of President Donald Trump. 
…
